query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Così di ponte in ponte, altro parlando 2 che la mia comedìa cantar non cura, 3 venimmo; e tenavamo ’l colmo, quando
4 restammo per veder l’altra fessura 5 di Malebolge e li altri pianti vani; 6 e vidila mirabilmente oscura.
query.result:
**English:**
1 Thus from bridge to bridge, talking of other things 2 that my Comedy does not care to sing, 3 we came; and we were at the summit, when
4 we stopped to see the other fissure 5 of Malebolge and the other vain lamentations; 6 and I saw it wonderfully dark.
**Sanskrit:**
1 Evam setubhyo setubhyaḥ, anyad bruvāṇau 2 yad mama kāvyam gātum na icchati, 3 āgamyāvahe; ca śṛṅgam āsīva, yadā
4 tiṣṭhāva ānyām vipaṭṭim draṣṭum 5 Malebolge-asya ca anyāni śokāni mithyāni; 6 ca adarśam tām adbhuta-rūpeṇa andhakārāṇvitām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 Quale ne l’arzanà de’ Viniziani 8 bolle l’inverno la tenace pece 9 a rimpalmare i legni lor non sani,
10 ché navicar non ponno—in quella vece 11 chi fa suo legno novo e chi ristoppa 12 le coste a quel che più vïaggi fece;
13 chi ribatte da proda e chi da poppa; 14 altri fa remi e altri volge sarte; 15 chi terzeruolo e artimon rintoppa—:
16 tal, non per foco ma per divin’ arte, 17 bollia là giuso una pegola spessa, 18 che ’nviscava la ripa d’ogne parte.
query.result:
**English:**
7 Like in the Venetian arsenal 8 in winter the sticky pitch boils 9 to caulk their unsound ships,
10 because they cannot sail—at that time 11 some make their ships anew and some repair 12 the ribs of those that have made more voyages;
13 some hammer away at the prow and some at the poop; 14 others make oars and others twist ropes; 15 some patch the sails and the mizzen-sails—:
16 so, not by fire but by divine art, 17 down there a thick pitch was boiling, 18 which smeared the banks on every side.
**Sanskrit:**
7 Yathā Vineśvara-nāvikāgṛhe 8 hime śīta-kāle pakvā rasāyanā, 9 tair eva svakīya-jairṇair nāva-saṃskāraḥ kriyate,
10 yataḥ te tasyām ṛtau na pravrajanti—tadā 11 ke cid nāvam nava-nirmāṇam kurvanti, ke cid 12 pūrva-pravṛtta-yātrā-bahulāyā nāvaḥ paścimāṃ dṛḍhayanti;
13 ke cid agreṇa, ke cid paścād abhighātam dattva samskurvanti; 14 anye āraṇyāni nirmanti, anye śara-rajjūḥ parivartayanti; 15 anye trikonāni patākāni, anye mūla-patākāni samskurvanti—:
16 tathā, na agninā api tu daivī śaktyā, 17 adhastāt pakvā āsīt snigdhā rasāyanā, 18 yā sarvataḥ tīram āveśayati sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 I’ vedea lei, ma non vedëa in essa 20 mai che le bolle che ’l bollor levava, 21 e gonfiar tutta, e riseder compressa.
query.result:
**English:**
19 I saw her, but I did not see in her 20 anything but the bubbles that the boiling raised, 21 and all swollen, and subside compressed.
**Sanskrit:**
19 Tām ahaṃ apaśyam, na tu apaśyam tasyāṃ 20 Kincit anyat, vinā taiḥ bubbulaiḥ, yān udghāṭayati udghāṭanam, 21 Sarvatra sphītam, punar api samākuñcitam ca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 Mentr’ io là giù fisamente mirava, 23 lo duca mio, dicendo «Guarda, guarda!», 24 mi trasse a sé del loco dov’ io stava.
query.result:
**English:**
22 While I was gazing fixedly down there, 23 my guide, saying "Look, look!", 24 drew me away from the place where I was standing.
**Sanskrit:**
22 Yāvad aham adhastāt sthiraṃ paśyāmi, 23 Mama netā, "Paśya, paśya!" iti bruvāṇaḥ, 24 Mām tataḥ sthānāt yatra aham tiṣṭhāmi, ākarṣat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Allor mi volsi come l’uom cui tarda 26 di veder quel che li convien fuggire 27 e cui paura sùbita sgagliarda,
28 che, per veder, non indugia ’l partire: 29 e vidi dietro a noi un diavol nero 30 correndo su per lo scoglio venire.
query.result:
**English:**
25 Then I turned like a man who is eager 26 to see that which he must flee, 27 and whom sudden fear unmans,
28 so that, to see, he does not delay his departure: 29 and I saw behind us a black devil 30 running up over the cliff.
**Sanskrit:**
25 Tatra ahaṃ vavṛte yathā naraḥ yaḥ śīghram icchati 26 paśyātum yat tam enam abhiyātum arhati 27 ca yasya bhayam āśu balam hanti,
28 yaḥ, paśyātum, na vilambayati prastānam: 29 ca apaśyam asmābhiḥ paścāt piśācam kṛṣṇavarṇam 30 dhavamānam upari śailasya āgacchantam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 Ahi quant’ elli era ne l’aspetto fero! 32 e quanto mi parea ne l’atto acerbo, 33 con l’ali aperte e sovra i piè leggero!
34 L’omero suo, ch’era aguto e superbo, 35 carcava un peccator con ambo l’anche, 36 e quei tenea de’ piè ghermito ’l nerbo.
query.result:
**English:**
31 Ah, how fierce he was to look at! 32 And how savage he seemed to me in his harsh attitude, 33 with his wings spread and his feet so light!
34 His shoulders, which were sharp and proud, 35 were carrying a sinner with both his claws, 36 and he held the sinew of his feet tightly gripped.
**Sanskrit:**
31 Aha katham asau āsīt ākāreṇa krauṇḍaḥ! 32 Evaṃ ca katham me adṛśyata pravṛttau kaṭukāyām, 33 Vikaṭair api pakṣaiḥ śīghraiḥ caraṇaiḥ ca!
34 Skandhau tasya, yau āstām tīkṣṇau ca garviṣṭhau ca, 35 Bibhrad āstaṃ pāpinam ubhabhyām nakhaiḥ, 36 Sa ca gṛhītaḥ āsīt caraṇayoḥ snāyuḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 Del nostro ponte disse: «O Malebranche, 38 ecco un de li anzïan di Santa Zita! 39 Mettetel sotto, ch’i’ torno per anche
40 a quella terra, che n’è ben fornita: 41 ogn’ uom v’è barattier, fuor che Bonturo; 42 del no, per li denar, vi si fa ita».
query.result:
**English:**
37 Of our bridge he said: "O Malebranche, 38 here is one of the elders of Santa Zita! 39 Put him under, for I am returning again
40 to that land, which is well supplied with them: 41 every man there is a barrator, except Bonturo; 42 there, for money, 'no' is turned into 'yes'."
**Sanskrit:**
37 Asmadīyasya setorohāha: "He Malebranche, 38 ayam Santa Zita-sthitānāṃ vṛddhānāṃ madhye ekaḥ! 39 Enam adhastāt sthāpayata, aham punarapi
40 tatra deśe pratyāgacchāmi, yaḥ etaiḥ sampūrṇo 'sti: 41 tatra sarve naraḥ vyavahārikāḥ santi, Bonturo vinā; 42 tatra dhanaṃ prāpya na-śabdasya api ita-śabdaḥ kriyate."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 Là giù ’l buttò, e per lo scoglio duro 44 si volse; e mai non fu mastino sciolto 45 con tanta fretta a seguitar lo furo.
query.result:
**English:**
43 There below he threw it, and toward the hard rock 44 he turned; and never was unleashed mastiff 45 with such eagerness to pursue the thief.
**Sanskrit:**
43 Adhastāt tat kṣiptavan, tataś ca kathinaṃ śilāṃ prati 44 pravṛttaḥ; kadācit api mastī mṛṣṭaḥ 45 tathāvidhāṃ śīghratāṃ na prāptavān choram anugamane.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 Quel s’attuffò, e tornò sù convolto; 47 ma i demon che del ponte avean coperchio, 48 gridar: «Qui non ha loco il Santo Volto!
49 qui si nuota altrimenti che nel Serchio! 50 Però, se tu non vuo’ di nostri graffi, 51 non far sopra la pegola soverchio».
query.result:
**English:**
46 He plunged in, and came up again with his face twisted; 47 but the demons who were guarding the bridge, 48 shouted: "Here the Holy Face has no place!
49 Here one swims differently than in the Serchio! 50 Therefore, if you don't want our claws, 51 don't linger too long on the pitch."
**Sanskrit:**
46 Saḥ nimajjya punar āvirabhūt vaktram vikṛtya; 47 ye tu rākṣasāḥ setum ācchādayanti sma, 48 te jagur: "Atra na vidyate sthānam śrīmukhāyasya!
49 Atra Serchiyāḥ anyathā plavate! 50 Ata eva, yadi na icchasi asmākam nakhāgrahaṇam, 51 mā kṛthāḥ pīṭikāyāṃ cirakālam."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 Poi l’addentar con più di cento raffi, 53 disser: «Coverto convien che qui balli, 54 sì che, se puoi, nascosamente accaffi».
query.result:
**English:**
52 Then, seizing him with more than a hundred hooks, 53 they said: "You must dance here, covered up, 54 so that, if you can, you may secretly pilfer."
**Sanskrit:**
52 Tataḥ śatādhikair daṇḍakaiḥ tam gṛhītvā, 53 āhuḥ: "Ācchāditaḥ khalu atra nṛtyam kartum arhasi, 54 yathā, yadi śaknoși, guhyataḥ ācauryaṃ kuryāḥ."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 Non altrimenti i cuoci a’ lor vassalli 56 fanno attuffare in mezzo la caldaia 57 la carne con li uncin, perché non galli.
query.result:
**English:**
55 Cooks do not otherwise plunge 56 meat into the middle of the boiling cauldron 57 with their hooks, so that it will not float.
**Sanskrit:**
55 Na anyathā pācakāḥ sva-vaśyāḥ 56 madhye kaṣāye mṛga-māṃsam āveśayanti 57 ākiñcanair āyudhair yathā na pṛthak-bhūtam bhavet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 Poscia passò di là dal co del ponte; 65 e com’ el giunse in su la ripa sesta, 66 mestier li fu d’aver sicura fronte.
query.result:
**English:**
64 Then he passed beyond the arch of the bridge; 65 and when he arrived on the sixth bank, 66 it was necessary for him to have a confident bearing.
**Sanskrit:**
64 Tataḥ sa setubandhātītam jagāma; 65 yadā ca ṣaṣṭhatīre tasya āgamanaṃ jātam, 66 tadā tasya niścitam manaḥ kartum āvaśyakam abhavat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Con quel furore e con quella tempesta 68 ch’escono i cani a dosso al poverello 69 che di sùbito chiede ove s’arresta,
70 usciron quei di sotto al ponticello, 71 e volser contra lui tutt’ i runcigli; 72 ma el gridò: «Nessun di voi sia fello!
73 Innanzi che l’uncin vostro mi pigli, 74 traggasi avante l’un di voi che m’oda, 75 e poi d’arruncigliarmi si consigli».
query.result:
**English:**
67 With that fury and with that tempest 68 with which the hounds rush upon the poor wretch 69 who suddenly stops where he is,
70 those from beneath the little bridge came out, 71 and turned all their hooks against him; 72 but he shouted: "Let none of you be fierce!
73 Before your hooks seize me, 74 let one of you step forward to hear me, 75 and then let him decide whether to tear me to pieces."
**Sanskrit:**
67 Tena krodhena tena ca prachandena 68 Yena śvānaḥ pradhāvanti daridrasya pṛṣṭhe 69 Yaḥ āścaryeṇa tiṣṭhati yatraiva,
70 Nirjagmuḥ te adhastāt setoh, 71 Sarvāṇi ca śūlāni tasya prati niyuktavantaḥ; 72 Sa tu akarod: "Mā bhavatu kaścid yuṣmākameva durjanaḥ!
73 Pūrvam yāvad mama aṅkuśaḥ gṛhṇāti, 74 Ekatra āgacchatām mama śravaṇāya, 75 Tataḥ mama viśalyakaraṇe vicārayatu."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 Tutti gridaron: «Vada Malacoda!»; 77 per ch’un si mosse—e li altri stetter fermi— 78 e venne a lui dicendo: «Che li approda?».
query.result:
**English:**
76 They all shouted: "Malacoda, go!" 77 Because of which one of them moved—and the others stood still— 78 and came to him, saying: "What good will it do them?"
**Sanskrit:**
76 Sarve akrośan: "Malacoda, gaccha!" 77 Yena ekaḥ acaṣṭa—anye ca sthitāḥ āsīt— 78 Tataś ca tasya समीpe āgataḥ uvāca: "Kim eteṣām prayojanam?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 «Credi tu, Malacoda, qui vedermi 80 esser venuto», disse ’l mio maestro, 81 «sicuro già da tutti vostri schermi,
82 sanza voler divino e fato destro? 83 Lascian’ andar, ché nel cielo è voluto 84 ch’i’ mostri altrui questo cammin silvestro».
query.result:
**English:**
79 "Do you think, Malacoda, to see me here 80 has come," said my master, 81 "already secure from all your defenses,
82 without divine will and favorable fate? 83 Let us pass, for it is willed in heaven 84 that I show others this wild path."
**Sanskrit:**
79 "Manye tvām, Malacoda, atra mama darśanam 80 āgatam," iti āha mama guruḥ, 81 "niścitam idānīm sarvebhyaḥ yuṣmākaṃ pratibandhebhyaḥ,
82 anṛte daivānukūle ca vidhātau? 83 Mokṣaya asmān, yataḥ svarge icchitam 84 mama anyebhyaḥ ayam mārgaḥ āraṇyaḥ darśayitum."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 Allor li fu l’orgoglio sì caduto, 86 ch’e’ si lasciò cascar l’uncino a’ piedi, 87 e disse a li altri: «Omai non sia feruto».
query.result:
**English:**
85 Then his pride fell so low, 86 that he let the hook drop at his feet, 87 and said to the others: "Let no one strike him again."
**Sanskrit:**
85 Tatra tasya abhimānaḥ tathā nipatitaḥ, 86 yataḥ sa svayam ankaśaṃ pādayoḥ patayām āsa, 87 ca anyebhyaḥ uvāca: "Adhunā ayam mā haniṣyatām."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 E ’l duca mio a me: «O tu che siedi 89 tra li scheggion del ponte quatto quatto, 90 sicuramente omai a me ti riedi».
query.result:
**English:**
88 And my leader to me: "O you who sit 89 among the fragments of the bridge, crouching low, 90 now come back to me without fear."
**Sanskrit:**
88 Evaṃ ca mama netā mama prati: "He bho! Tvam yaḥ 89 Setubandhānāṃ khaṇḍeṣu catuṣcatuṣaḥ āsīnaḥ asi, 90 Abhayena mama prati āgaccha."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 I’ m’accostai con tutta la persona 98 lungo ’l mio duca, e non torceva li occhi 99 da la sembianza lor ch’era non buona.
query.result:
**English:**
97 I approached them with my whole body 98 next to my guide, and I did not turn my eyes 99 from their appearance, which was not good.
**Sanskrit:**
97 Aham sakalena śarīreṇa upapannaḥ 98 Mama nāyakasya paścāt, na ca apavarttitavantaḥ 99 Teṣāṃ rūpāt, yat na śubham āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 Ei chinavan li raffi e «Vuo’ che ’l tocchi», 101 diceva l’un con l’altro, «in sul groppone?». 102 E rispondien: «Sì, fa che gliel’ accocchi».
query.result:
**English:**
100 They bowed their necks and said to each other, 101 "Do you want him to touch you on the haunches?" 102 And they replied, "Yes, do it so that he gets on our backs."
**Sanskrit:**
100 Teṣāṃ grīvāḥ namantasteṣāṃ parasparam āha, 101 "Icchase tvayā sparśanam kṛtam śiromaṇḍale?" 102 Te ca pratyuttaram adaduḥ, "Tathā kuru yathā ayam asmākaṃ pṛṣṭheṣu āruhyet."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Ma quel demonio che tenea sermone 104 col duca mio, si volse tutto presto 105 e disse: «Posa, posa, Scarmiglione!».
query.result:
**English:**
103 But that demon who was speaking 104 with my leader, turned around very quickly 105 and said: "Stop, stop, Scarmiglione!"
**Sanskrit:**
103 Sa tu rākṣasaḥ yaḥ samvādam ācakāra 104 mama netṛṇā saha, sa sarvaṃ śīghram eva parāvṛttaḥ 105 uvāca ca: "Viśrāma, viśrāma, Karabhaṇḍa!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 Poi disse a noi: «Più oltre andar per questo 107 iscoglio non si può, però che giace 108 tutto spezzato al fondo l’arco sesto.
query.result:
**English:**
106 Then he said to us: "It is not possible to go further 107 along this cliff, because the sixth arch lies 108 completely broken at the bottom.
**Sanskrit:**
106 Tataḥ sa asmākam avocat: "Aparam atra 107 aśmabhittāvabhitaragaṇena gantum na śakyate, yataḥ 108 ṣaṣṭhaḥ kaṇṭakaḥ mūle samastaḥ vihīnaḥ asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 E se l’andare avante pur vi piace, 110 andatevene su per questa grotta; 111 presso è un altro scoglio che via face.
query.result:
**English:**
109 And if it pleases you to go forward, 110 go up over this cliff; 111 nearby is another crag that makes a way.
**Sanskrit:**
109 Atha yadi agre gamanam eva yuşmabhyam rocate, 110 gacchata etasya parvatasya upari; 111 asminnasanne eva anyaḥ parvataḥ asti yaḥ mārgaṃ karoti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 Ier, più oltre cinqu’ ore che quest’ otta, 113 mille dugento con sessanta sei 114 anni compié che qui la via fu rotta.
query.result:
**English:**
112 Yesterday, more than five hours after this hour, 113 one thousand two hundred and sixty-six 114 years completed since the way was broken here.
**Sanskrit:**
112 Iha, adhikaṃ pañca ghaṭikāni asmāt samayaḥ, 113 sahasrāṇi dve śate ṣaṣṭiḥ ṣaṭ ca 114 samāḥ gatāḥ varṣāṇi yasmāt kālaḥ pataḥ bhinnam abhavat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 Io mando verso là di questi miei 116 a riguardar s’alcun se ne sciorina; 117 gite con lor, che non saranno rei».
query.result:
**English:**
115 I am sending some of these followers of mine 116 to see if any of them can escape; 117 go with them, for they will not be harmful."
**Sanskrit:**
115 Aham prahiṇāmi tatraimeṣāṃ madīyānāṃ kecan, 116 paśyāntu kim kecid atra mucyante; 117 yāta saha taiḥ, na hi te bhavanti pāpakṛtyaḥ."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 «Tra’ti avante, Alichino, e Calcabrina», 119 cominciò elli a dire, «e tu, Cagnazzo; 120 e Barbariccia guidi la decina.
query.result:
**English:**
118 "Go on ahead, Alichino and Calcabrina," 119 he began to say, "and you, Cagnazzo; 120 and Barbariccia, lead the squad."
**Sanskrit:**
118 "Trayo 'vante, Alichino, Calcabrina-śca," 119 ārabhata saḥ vaktuṃ, "tvaṃ ca, Cagnazzo; 120 Barbaricciś ca nayatu daśakam."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 Libicocco vegn’ oltre e Draghignazzo, 122 Cirïatto sannuto e Graffiacane 123 e Farfarello e Rubicante pazzo.
query.result:
**English:**
121 Libicocco came next, and Draghignazzo, 122 Ciriatto, snarling, and Graffiacane, 123 and Farfarello, and Rubicante the madman.
**Sanskrit:**
121 Libicoccaḥ āgataḥ aparaḥ ca Draghignazzaḥ, 122 Ciriāṭṭaḥ sannaddhaḥ ca Graphiācāṇaḥ ca, 123 ca Farfarellaḥ ca Rubicāntaḥ ca unmattaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 Cercate ’ntorno le boglienti pane; 125 costor sian salvi infino a l’altro scheggio 126 che tutto intero va sovra le tane».
query.result:
**English:**
124 Seek around the boiling springs; 125 these may be saved until the other crag 126 that goes all the way over the dens.
**Sanskrit:**
124 Uṣṇapravahāṇāṃ sarvataḥ paryālocanam kuru; 125 ete tāvat tārakāḥ parārdhe śaile parirakṣitā bhavanti, 126 yaḥ sarvaḥ śailo guhābhyaḥ upari vartate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 «Omè, maestro, che è quel ch’i’ veggio?», 128 diss’ io, «deh, sanza scorta andianci soli, 129 se tu sa’ ir; ch’i’ per me non la cheggio.
query.result:
**English:**
127 "Oh me, master, what is that which I see?", 128 I said, "tell me, without a guide, let us go alone, 129 if you know the way; for I do not ask it for myself.
**Sanskrit:**
127 «Ahaṃ, gurūn, kim etad yadi paśyāmi?», 128 uvāca aham, «hā, anena vinā netṛṇā ekāki eva gacchāvaḥ, 129 yadi tvam jānāsi gantum; aham tu tat svayam na prārthayāmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Se tu se’ sì accorto come suoli, 131 non vedi tu ch’e’ digrignan li denti 132 e con le ciglia ne minaccian duoli?».
query.result:
**English:**
130 If you are as wise as you usually are, 131 don't you see that they are gnashing their teeth 132 and threatening us with pain with their eyebrows?
**Sanskrit:**
130 Yadi tvam asi tathā prajñavān yathā bhavasi, 131 na vetsi kim ete dantaṃścaṭaṭāyanti 132 bhrukuṭyā ca duḥkham asmābhiḥ saha cintayanti?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 Ed elli a me: «Non vo’ che tu paventi; 134 lasciali digrignar pur a lor senno, 135 ch’e’ fanno ciò per li lessi dolenti».
query.result:
**English:**
133 And he to me: "I do not want you to be afraid; 134 let them gnash their teeth as much as they want, 135 for they do this because of their sorrowful mourning."
**Sanskrit:**
133 Sa ca mama: "Na tvām abhītuṃarhasi; 134 tyaja tāṃstanniṣkṛṣṭānāṃkṛpaṇānāṃkṛpaṇāṃbuddhim, 135 ye duḥkhitāḥśokārtāḥevameva kurvanti."
